intro: Achyranthes ferruginea, commonly known as redroot sida, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its upright stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its roots are often reddish in color, which gives it its common name. It is commonly found in moist soils and is used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
